articles.head: The Fight for Jackson Park
articles.subhead: The future of the Obama Presidential Center (OPC) and Jackson Park, the planned site of the Center, remains uncertain after a summer of legal action and community activism both for and against proposed construction plans.

articles.head: Election 2020: Who Did UChicago Students Campaign For?
articles.subhead: Elizabeth Warren’s campaign was most popular. Kamala Harris and Pete Buttigieg were also favorites.

articles.head: The University and the Trump Administration
articles.subhead: The Trump administration has influenced the future of undocumented students, the adjudication of sexual assault cases, union organizing, admissions policies, and freedom of expression.

articles.head: Who's Who in Local Government
articles.subhead: Here’s a breakdown of who you need to know in the executive and legislative branches of the city government.

articles.head: Who's Who: Professors Iconic, Beloved, and Infamous
articles.subhead: Compared to some faculty members, students can seem like the least zany members of the University.

articles.head: Who's Who: University Administrators
articles.subhead: The names to know in University administration.

articles.head: Student Government at UChicago: A Primer
articles.subhead: Student Government at UChicago manages an annual budget of more than $2 million.

articles.head: A History of Resistance: Politics and Activism on Campus
articles.subhead: The quad appeared somewhat unrecognizable during finals week last quarter. Juxtaposed to the green idyll of a manicured, springtime UChicago were picket lines encircling each ivy-clad building.

articles.head: Sororities and Fraternities at UChicago
articles.subhead: There are more than 20 Greek organizations currently operating on campus, including four sororities within the UChicago Panhellenic Council. Most fraternities have houses off-campus; unusually, none of UChicago’s sororities has a house.

articles.head: How To Save Money as a UChicago Student
articles.subhead: College living is expensive. Here are a few budget-trimming tips.

articles.head: When You Need A Hand: Health And Wellbeing At The University
articles.subhead: If you experience difficulties at UChicago, there are several resources you can turn to for help.

articles.head: Life of the Spirit: A Guide to Religion on Campus
articles.subhead: Student groups and community spots include Bible study groups, nondenominational chapels, and a mosque founded by boxing legend Muhammad Ali.

articles.head: Solidarity With Grad Workers!
articles.subhead: We work for the University, and we want an organized voice in decisions that affect us.

articles.head: CIA Recruitment on Campus Must End
articles.subhead: Due to the CIA’s complicity in human rights violations, students should oppose professional opportunities with the organization.

articles.head: Starting College After a Gap Year
articles.subhead: Though many worry about starting college a year later than expected, adjusting to college after a gap year isn’t as difficult as it’s assumed to be.

articles.head: Dear Incoming Freshmen: It Will Be Okay
articles.subhead: While there exists a slew of unhelpful advice for college freshmen, incoming students should rest assured that their first year will be challenging, enjoyable, and unique to them.

articles.head: The Neverending Quarter System Summer
articles.subhead: Anticipating the next academic year at UChicago may lead to various expectations, and even anxiety about a new year.

articles.head: The Profound Benefits of Add-Drop
articles.subhead: First-year students shouldn’t be wary of adding and dropping courses at the start of the quarter, as it often proves to be helpful.

articles.head: The Myth of the Impenetrable College Clique
articles.subhead: While exclusive friend groups were commonplace in high school, UChicago’s social scene is less daunting if you remain open-minded.

articles.head: The Importance of Candor and Communication
articles.subhead: Though social anxiety is quite common at UChicago, there is still room for building confidence through kindness and honesty.

articles.head: Marching to the Beat of Your Own Drum: Music at UChicago
articles.subhead: From the classical to the contemporary and the well-established to the student-run, opportunities to play and appreciate music abound at UChicago.

articles.head: Dunking the Brush: Visual Arts on Campus
articles.subhead: Whether you’re looking to make art or appreciate it, the UChicago campus is brimming with opportunities for you to make happy little accidents.

articles.head: Where to Get Your Groove on at UChicago
articles.subhead: From ballet to hip-hop, swing dance to K-pop, the College community is bursting with opportunities for the kinetically inclined to stretch their feet.

articles.head: Theater on Campus
articles.subhead: Feeling a little dramatic this o-week? Put your emotions to good use by getting involved in campus' theater scene.

articles.head: Arts and Culture Off Campus
articles.subhead: We've pulled together a tiny sampling of the many, many, artsy opportunities that Chicago has to offer.
